intro: Amylotheca boholensis, commonly known as the Bohol velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, broad leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, lowland areas and is adapted to tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
